file.content:
{
  "name": "claude-chats-sync",
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "description": "Cross-platform CLI tool to sync Claude Code chat sessions to project directory",
  "main": "bin/claude-chats-sync.js",
  "bin": {
    "claude-chats-sync": "./bin/claude-chats-sync.js"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "init": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js init",
    "status": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js status",
    "open": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js open",
    "clean": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js clean",
    "setup-git-filter": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js setup-git-filter",
    "update": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js update",
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "claude",
    "claude-code",
    "claude-ai",
    "sync",
    "chat",
    "sessions",
    "cli",
    "vscode",
    "git",
    "version-control",
    "developer-tools"
  ],
  "author": {
    "name": "tubo70",
    "email": "445527@qq.com"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli#readme",
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=14.0.0"
  },
  "os": [
    "win32",
    "darwin",
    "linux"
  ],
  "preferGlobal": true,
  "files": [
    "bin/",
    "README.md",
    "LICENSE"
  ]
}

1â†’# Changelog
     2â†’
     3â†’All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.
     4â†’
     5â†’The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
     6â†’and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).
     7â†’
     8â†’## [Unreleased]
     9â†’
    10â†’## [0.2.0] - 2025-01-17
    11â†’
    12â†’### Added
    13â†’- Enhanced .gitignore configuration with additional patterns:
    14â†’  - `sessions-index.json` in all subdirectories
    15â†’  - `tmpclaude*` temporary files
    16â†’- Security warnings displayed during `init` and `update` commands
    17â†’- Automatic update on `init` when project is already initialized
    18â†’
    19â†’### Changed
    20â†’- `.gitignore` entries now added without comment by default (previously commented)
    21â†’- `init` command now automatically runs `update` if project is already initialized
    22â†’- Improved .gitignore update logic to intelligently add missing entries only
    23â†’- Enhanced user awareness about security best practices
    24â†’
    25â†’### Security
    26â†’- Session files now ignored by Git by default with comprehensive patterns
    27â†’- Users are explicitly warned about sensitive information in session files
    28â†’- Clear recommendations for using environment variables for API keys
    29â†’
    30â†’## [0.1.1] - 2025-01-11
    31â†’
    32â†’### Fixed
    33â†’- Fixed `normalizeProjectPath` to replace dots (`.`) with dashes (`-`) in project directory names
    34â†’- Ensures compatibility with Claude Code's naming convention for directories containing dots
    35â†’
    36â†’## [0.1.0] - 2025-01-09
    37â†’
    38â†’### Fixed
    39â†’- Fixed `.gitattributes` pattern to use `**/*.jsonl` instead of `/*.jsonl`
    40â†’- Now correctly matches all `.jsonl` files in nested subdirectories (e.g., `subagents/*.jsonl`)
    41â†’
    42â†’## [0.0.9] - 2025-01-09
    43â†’
    44â†’### Added
    45â†’- `update` command to upgrade Git filter configuration for existing projects
    46â†’- Automatic detection and upgrade of outdated filter configurations
    47â†’
    48â†’### Changed
    49â†’- Improved `init` command to inform users about `update` command for existing projects
    50â†’
    51â†’## [0.0.8] - 2025-01-09
    52â†’
    53â†’### Added
    54â†’- Git smudge filter to restore absolute paths on checkout
    55â†’- Automatic path normalization for cross-platform compatibility
    56â†’
    57â†’### Changed
    58â†’- Enhanced clean filter to remove absolute paths from `cwd` field in session files
    59â†’- Updated `.gitattributes` pattern to match all `.jsonl` files in subdirectories (`**/*.jsonl`)
    60â†’- Absolute paths in `cwd` field are now replaced with project directory name only on commit
    61â†’- When checking out files, project names are automatically restored to absolute paths based on current system
    62â†’
    63â†’### Fixed
    64â†’- Git filter now correctly processes session files in nested subdirectories
    65â†’- Path cleaning now works for both Windows (`d:\Projects\...`) and Unix (`/home/user/...`) absolute paths
    66â†’
    67â†’## [0.0.7] - 2025-01-06
    68â†’
    69â†’### Fixed
    70â†’- Fixed `isSymlink` function on Windows to correctly distinguish between physical directories and junctions/symlinks
    71â†’- Previously, all directories were incorrectly detected as symlinks on Windows
    72â†’- Now properly uses `fs.readlinkSync()` to detect if a directory is actually a junction or symlink
    73â†’- Fixes scenario where physical directories in Claude storage were incorrectly treated as already initialized
    74â†’
    75â†’## [0.0.6] - 2025-01-06
    76â†’
    77â†’### Fixed
    78â†’- Fixed `init` command to properly handle projects with existing `.claudeCodeSessions` folder
    79â†’- Now correctly creates symlink to project's existing session folder when shared from other sources
    80â†’- Added intelligent merge functionality when both Claude storage and project folder contain sessions
    81â†’- Improved handling of multiple scenarios: empty folders, existing sessions, and session merging
    82â†’
    83â†’## [0.0.5] - 2025-01-02
    84â†’
    85â†’### Fixed
    86â†’- Fixed Linux/Mac path normalization to match Claude Code behavior
    87â†’- Unix paths now correctly include leading dash (e.g., `/home/user/projects` â†’ `-home-user-projects`)
    88â†’
    89â†’## [0.0.1] - 2025-01-02
    90â†’
    91â†’### Added
    92â†’- Initial release
    93â†’- Cross-platform CLI tool for syncing Claude Code chat sessions
    94â†’- `init` command to initialize sync with symlink creation
    95â†’- `status` command to check sync status and session count
    96â†’- `open` command to open history folder in file manager
    97â†’- `clean` command to manually clean sensitive data from session files
    98â†’- `setup-git-filter` command to configure Git automatic cleaning
    99â†’- Git filter for automatic API key cleaning on commit
   100â†’- Support for custom folder names via `--folder-name` option
   101â†’- Force migration option via `--force` flag
   102â†’- Project path option via `--project-path`
   103â†’- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
   104â†’- Colored terminal output for better readability
   105â†’- Bilingual error messages (English/Chinese)
   106â†’
   107â†’### Security
   108â†’- Automatic API key cleaning from session files
   109â†’- Git filter configuration for safe version control
   110â†’- Environment variable support for secure API key storage
   111â†’
   112â†’[Unreleased]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.2.0...HEAD
   113â†’[0.2.0]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.1.1...v0.2.0

   115â†’[0.1.0]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.9...v0.1.0
   116â†’[0.0.9]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.8...v0.0.9
   117â†’[0.0.8]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.7...v0.0.8
   118â†’[0.0.7]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.6...v0.0.7
   119â†’[0.0.6]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.5...v0.0.6

   122â†’

file.content:
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [0.2.0] - 2025-01-17

### Added
- Enhanced .gitignore configuration with additional patterns:
  - `sessions-index.json` in all subdirectories
  - `tmpclaude*` temporary files
- Security warnings displayed during `init` and `update` commands
- Automatic update on `init` when project is already initialized

### Changed
- `.gitignore` entries now added without comment by default (previously commented)
- `init` command now automatically runs `update` if project is already initialized
- Improved .gitignore update logic to intelligently add missing entries only
- Enhanced user awareness about security best practices

### Security
- Session files now ignored by Git by default with comprehensive patterns
- Users are explicitly warned about sensitive information in session files
- Clear recommendations for using environment variables for API keys

## [0.1.1] - 2025-01-11

### Fixed
- Fixed `normalizeProjectPath` to replace dots (`.`) with dashes (`-`) in project directory names
- Ensures compatibility with Claude Code's naming convention for directories containing dots

## [0.1.0] - 2025-01-09

### Fixed
- Fixed `.gitattributes` pattern to use `**/*.jsonl` instead of `/*.jsonl`
- Now correctly matches all `.jsonl` files in nested subdirectories (e.g., `subagents/*.jsonl`)

## [0.0.9] - 2025-01-09

### Added
- `update` command to upgrade Git filter configuration for existing projects
- Automatic detection and upgrade of outdated filter configurations

### Changed
- Improved `init` command to inform users about `update` command for existing projects

## [0.0.8] - 2025-01-09

### Added
- Git smudge filter to restore absolute paths on checkout
- Automatic path normalization for cross-platform compatibility

### Changed
- Enhanced clean filter to remove absolute paths from `cwd` field in session files
- Updated `.gitattributes` pattern to match all `.jsonl` files in subdirectories (`**/*.jsonl`)
- Absolute paths in `cwd` field are now replaced with project directory name only on commit
- When checking out files, project names are automatically restored to absolute paths based on current system

### Fixed
- Git filter now correctly processes session files in nested subdirectories
- Path cleaning now works for both Windows (`d:\Projects\...`) and Unix (`/home/user/...`) absolute paths

## [0.0.7] - 2025-01-06

### Fixed
- Fixed `isSymlink` function on Windows to correctly distinguish between physical directories and junctions/symlinks
- Previously, all directories were incorrectly detected as symlinks on Windows
- Now properly uses `fs.readlinkSync()` to detect if a directory is actually a junction or symlink
- Fixes scenario where physical directories in Claude storage were incorrectly treated as already initialized

## [0.0.6] - 2025-01-06

### Fixed
- Fixed `init` command to properly handle projects with existing `.claudeCodeSessions` folder
- Now correctly creates symlink to project's existing session folder when shared from other sources
- Added intelligent merge functionality when both Claude storage and project folder contain sessions
- Improved handling of multiple scenarios: empty folders, existing sessions, and session merging

## [0.0.5] - 2025-01-02

### Fixed
- Fixed Linux/Mac path normalization to match Claude Code behavior
- Unix paths now correctly include leading dash (e.g., `/home/user/projects` â†’ `-home-user-projects`)

## [0.0.1] - 2025-01-02

### Added
- Initial release
- Cross-platform CLI tool for syncing Claude Code chat sessions
- `init` command to initialize sync with symlink creation
- `status` command to check sync status and session count
- `open` command to open history folder in file manager
- `clean` command to manually clean sensitive data from session files
- `setup-git-filter` command to configure Git automatic cleaning
- Git filter for automatic API key cleaning on commit
- Support for custom folder names via `--folder-name` option
- Force migration option via `--force` flag
- Project path option via `--project-path`
- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- Colored terminal output for better readability
- Bilingual error messages (English/Chinese)

### Security
- Automatic API key cleaning from session files
- Git filter configuration for safe version control
- Environment variable support for secure API key storage

[Unreleased]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.2.0...HEAD
[0.2.0]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.1.1...v0.2.0
[0.1.1]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.1.0...v0.1.1
[0.1.0]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.9...v0.1.0
[0.0.9]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.8...v0.0.9
[0.0.8]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.7...v0.0.8
[0.0.7]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.6...v0.0.7
[0.0.6]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.5...v0.0.6
[0.0.5]: https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/compare/v0.0.1...v0.0.5

{
  "name": "claude-chats-sync",
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "description": "Cross-platform CLI tool to sync Claude Code chat sessions to project directory",
  "main": "bin/claude-chats-sync.js",
  "bin": {
    "claude-chats-sync": "./bin/claude-chats-sync.js"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "init": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js init",
    "status": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js status",
    "open": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js open",
    "clean": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js clean",
    "setup-git-filter": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js setup-git-filter",
    "update": "node bin/claude-chats-sync.js update",
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "claude",
    "claude-code",
    "claude-ai",
    "sync",
    "chat",
    "sessions",
    "cli",
    "vscode",
    "git",
    "version-control",
    "developer-tools"
  ],
  "author": {
    "name": "tubo70",
    "email": "445527@qq.com"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/tubo70/claude-chats-sync-cli#readme",
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=14.0.0"
  },
  "os": [
    "win32",
    "darwin",
    "linux"
  ],
  "preferGlobal": true,
  "files": [
    "bin/",
    "README.md",
    "LICENSE"
  ]
}

toolUseResult.newString:
## [Unreleased]

## [0.2.1] - 2025-01-25

### Added
- Enhanced .gitignore configuration with `tool-results` pattern to exclude tool execution results directories

### Changed
- Added `.claudeCodeSessions/**/tool-results` to .gitignore to prevent committing tool execution results

## [0.2.0] - 2025-01-17
toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [0.2.0] - 2025-01-17

### Added
- Enhanced .gitignore configuration with additional patterns:
  - `sessions-index.json` in all subdirectories
  - `tmpclaude*` temporary files
- Security warnings displayed during `init` and `update` commands
- Automatic update on `init` when project is already initialized

### Changed
- `.gitignore` entries now added without comment by default (previously commented)
- `init` command now automatically runs `update` if project is already initialized
- Improved .gitignore update logic to intelligently add missing entries only
- Enhanced user awareness about security best practices

### Security
- Session files now ignored by Git by default with comprehensive patterns
- Users are explicitly warned about sensitive information in session files
- Clear recommendations for using environment variables for API keys

## [0.1.1] - 2025-01-11

### Fixed
- Fixed `normalizeProjectPath` to replace dots (`.`) with dashes (`-`) in project directory names
- Ensures compatibility with Claude Code's naming convention for directories containing dots

## [0.1.0] - 2025-01-09

### Fixed
- Fixed `.gitattributes` pattern to use `**/*.jsonl` instead of `/*.jsonl`
- Now correctly matches all `.jsonl` files in nested subdirectories (e.g., `subagents/*.jsonl`)

## [0.0.9] - 2025-01-09

### Added
- `update` command to upgrade Git filter configuration for existing projects
- Automatic detection and upgrade of outdated filter configurations

### Changed
- Improved `init` command to inform users about `update` command for existing projects

## [0.0.8] - 2025-01-09

### Added
- Git smudge filter to restore absolute paths on checkout
- Automatic path normalization for cross-platform compatibility

### Changed
- Enhanced clean filter to remove absolute paths from `cwd` field in session files
- Updated `.gitattributes` pattern to match all `.jsonl` files in subdirectories (`**/*.jsonl`)
- Absolute paths in `cwd` field are now replaced with project directory name only on commit
- When checking out files, project names are automatically restored to absolute paths based on current system

### Fixed
- Git filter now correctly processes session files in nested subdirectories
- Path cleaning now works for both Windows (`d:\Projects\...`) and Unix (`/home/user/...`) absolute paths

## [0.0.7] - 2025-01-06

### Fixed
- Fixed `isSymlink` function on Windows to correctly distinguish between physical directories and junctions/symlinks
- Previously, all directories were incorrectly detected as symlinks on Windows
- Now properly uses `fs.readlinkSync()` to detect if a directory is actually a junction or symlink
- Fixes scenario where physical directories in Claude storage were incorrectly treated as already initialized

## [0.0.6] - 2025-01-06

### Fixed
- Fixed `init` command to properly handle projects with existing `.claudeCodeSessions` folder
- Now correctly creates symlink to project's existing session folder when shared from other sources
- Added intelligent merge functionality when both Claude storage and project folder contain sessions
- Improved handling of multiple scenarios: empty folders, existing sessions, and session merging

## [0.0.5] - 2025-01-02

### Fixed
- Fixed Linux/Mac path normalization to match Claude Code behavior
- Unix paths now correctly include leading dash (e.g., `/home/user/projects` â†’ `-home-user-projects`)

## [0.0.1] - 2025-01-02

### Added
- Initial release
- Cross-platform CLI tool for syncing Claude Code chat sessions
- `init` command to initialize sync with symlink creation
- `status` command to check sync status and session count
- `open` command to open history folder in file manager
- `clean` command to manually clean sensitive data from session files
- `setup-git-filter` command to configure Git automatic cleaning
- Git filter for automatic API key cleaning on commit
- Support for custom folder names via `--folder-name` option
- Force migration option via `--force` flag
- Project path option via `--project-path`
- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- Colored terminal output for better readability
- Bilingual error messages (English/Chinese)

### Security
- Automatic API key cleaning from session files
- Git filter configuration for safe version control
- Environment variable support for secure API key storage

# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [0.2.1] - 2025-01-25

### Added
- Enhanced .gitignore configuration with `tool-results` pattern to exclude tool execution results directories

### Changed
- Added `.claudeCodeSessions/**/tool-results` to .gitignore to prevent committing tool execution results

## [0.2.0] - 2025-01-17

### Added
- Enhanced .gitignore configuration with additional patterns:
  - `sessions-index.json` in all subdirectories
  - `tmpclaude*` temporary files
- Security warnings displayed during `init` and `update` commands
- Automatic update on `init` when project is already initialized

### Changed
- `.gitignore` entries now added without comment by default (previously commented)
- `init` command now automatically runs `update` if project is already initialized
- Improved .gitignore update logic to intelligently add missing entries only
- Enhanced user awareness about security best practices

### Security
- Session files now ignored by Git by default with comprehensive patterns
- Users are explicitly warned about sensitive information in session files
- Clear recommendations for using environment variables for API keys

## [0.1.1] - 2025-01-11

### Fixed
- Fixed `normalizeProjectPath` to replace dots (`.`) with dashes (`-`) in project directory names
- Ensures compatibility with Claude Code's naming convention for directories containing dots

## [0.1.0] - 2025-01-09

### Fixed
- Fixed `.gitattributes` pattern to use `**/*.jsonl` instead of `/*.jsonl`
- Now correctly matches all `.jsonl` files in nested subdirectories (e.g., `subagents/*.jsonl`)

## [0.0.9] - 2025-01-09

### Added
- `update` command to upgrade Git filter configuration for existing projects
- Automatic detection and upgrade of outdated filter configurations

### Changed
- Improved `init` command to inform users about `update` command for existing projects

## [0.0.8] - 2025-01-09

### Added
- Git smudge filter to restore absolute paths on checkout
- Automatic path normalization for cross-platform compatibility

### Changed
- Enhanced clean filter to remove absolute paths from `cwd` field in session files
- Updated `.gitattributes` pattern to match all `.jsonl` files in subdirectories (`**/*.jsonl`)
- Absolute paths in `cwd` field are now replaced with project directory name only on commit
- When checking out files, project names are automatically restored to absolute paths based on current system

### Fixed
- Git filter now correctly processes session files in nested subdirectories
- Path cleaning now works for both Windows (`d:\Projects\...`) and Unix (`/home/user/...`) absolute paths

## [0.0.7] - 2025-01-06

### Fixed
- Fixed `isSymlink` function on Windows to correctly distinguish between physical directories and junctions/symlinks
- Previously, all directories were incorrectly detected as symlinks on Windows
- Now properly uses `fs.readlinkSync()` to detect if a directory is actually a junction or symlink
- Fixes scenario where physical directories in Claude storage were incorrectly treated as already initialized

## [0.0.6] - 2025-01-06

### Fixed
- Fixed `init` command to properly handle projects with existing `.claudeCodeSessions` folder
- Now correctly creates symlink to project's existing session folder when shared from other sources
- Added intelligent merge functionality when both Claude storage and project folder contain sessions
- Improved handling of multiple scenarios: empty folders, existing sessions, and session merging

## [0.0.5] - 2025-01-02

### Fixed
- Fixed Linux/Mac path normalization to match Claude Code behavior
- Unix paths now correctly include leading dash (e.g., `/home/user/projects` â†’ `-home-user-projects`)

## [0.0.1] - 2025-01-02

### Added
- Initial release
- Cross-platform CLI tool for syncing Claude Code chat sessions
- `init` command to initialize sync with symlink creation
- `status` command to check sync status and session count
- `open` command to open history folder in file manager
- `clean` command to manually clean sensitive data from session files
- `setup-git-filter` command to configure Git automatic cleaning
- Git filter for automatic API key cleaning on commit
- Support for custom folder names via `--folder-name` option
- Force migration option via `--force` flag
- Project path option via `--project-path`
- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- Colored terminal output for better readability
- Bilingual error messages (English/Chinese)

### Security
- Automatic API key cleaning from session files
- Git filter configuration for safe version control
- Environment variable support for secure API key storage

input.command:
git add .gitignore CHANGELOG.md bin/claude-chats-sync.js package.json && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: Add tool-results to .gitignore (v0.2.1)

Enhanced .gitignore configuration to exclude tool execution results directories from version control. This prevents committing temporary tool output files generated during Claude Code sessions.

Changes:
- Added `.claudeCodeSessions/**/tool-results` pattern to .gitignore
- Updated addToGitIgnore function to include tool-results check
- Bumped version to 0.2.1

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)" && git status
input.description: Add files, commit changes, and check status

Release v0.2.1: Add tool-results to .gitignore

commit 213e87aed18fc6937afd4693aa8f56b586467ecb
Author: tubo <445527@qq.com>
Date:   Sun Jan 25 15:47:21 2026 +0800

    feat: Add tool-results to .gitignore (v0.2.1)
    
    Enhanced .gitignore configuration to exclude tool execution results directories from version control. This prevents committing temporary tool output files generated during Claude Code sessions.
    
    Changes:
    - Added `.claudeCodeSessions/**/tool-results` pattern to .gitignore
    - Updated addToGitIgnore function to include tool-results check
    - Bumped version to 0.2.1
    
    Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
